meanings.definition: Inflammation of a tendon or tendons.
meanings.sent1: Tendonitises can cause pain in the arms or legs.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often suffer from tendonitises due to overuse of their muscles.
meanings.sent3: The tendonitises in my wrist made it hard to hold a pencil, so I switched to typing.
meanings.sent4: Her frustration felt like a swarm of tendonitises attacking her body.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained that tendonitises are like angry red ants marching along the tendons.

meanings.definition: The condition of having inflamed tendons.
meanings.sent1: After the game, the player felt the effects of tendonitises in his knees.
meanings.sent2: Proper stretching can help prevent the development of tendonitises.
meanings.sent3: The tendonitises in his ankles made him walk like a penguin, much to his friends' amusement.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like a cloud of tendonitises hanging over them.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tendonitises glowing red on the X-ray was a stark reminder of the pain.
